docs.snippet: The National Book Awards candidates were announced yesterday. There was also an unannounced revolt by the judges against new selection procedures that were to have allowed a nationwide poll of booksellers, librarians and critics to select half of ...
docs.lead_paragraph: The National Book Awards candidates were announced yesterday. There was also an unannounced revolt by the judges against new selection procedures that were to have allowed a nationwide poll of booksellers, librarians and critics to select half of the 70 nominees.
docs.abstract: Natl Book nominations; awards sponsored by Natl Book Com, Amer Book Publishers Council, Amer Booksellers Assn and Book Mfrs Inst; judges revolt against nationwide selection procedure; reject every nominee selected in poll

headline.main: Judges of Book Awards Revolt On Use of Nationwide Polling

docs.snippet: The football season finally ended yesterday, the same day the American League released its 1971 baseball schedule. The weeks until April 5 stretch long and dreary and cold for those who have never cultivated the somewhat special tastes of the indo...
docs.lead_paragraph: The football season finally ended yesterday, the same day the American League released its 1971 baseball schedule. The weeks until April 5 stretch long and dreary and cold for those who have never cultivated the somewhat special tastes of the indoor season. Has Jim Ryun found his emotional second wind? Will Arthur Ashe crack the tiebreaker barrier? Can the Knicks regain their "unselfishness" before Philadelphia catches up?

headline.main: Sports of The Times; Moving Indoors

docs.snippet: Ramon Guthrie is a magnificent American poet in his seventies who has been overlooked. By "overlooked" I mean that his name and titles don't appear in either "Who's Who" or "Who's Who in the East" and that the most recent representative anthology ...
docs.lead_paragraph: Ramon Guthrie is a magnificent American poet in his seventies who has been overlooked. By "overlooked" I mean that his name and titles don't appear in either "Who's Who" or "Who's Who in the East" and that the most recent representative anthology of modern American poetry that I have seen, one edited by Hayden Carruth, doesn't include him.
docs.abstract: Guthrie, Ramon: Maximum Security Ward. 1964-1970, Maximum Security Ward. 1964-1970
